decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, counter magic, and powerful creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy and eventually overwhelm them with card advantage and powerful threats. By using cards like Quantum Riddler, Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck looks to slow down the opponent's game plan while building up its own resources and eventually winning the game through card advantage and powerful creatures. The deck also utilizes Teferi, Time Raveler and other disruptive cards to control the tempo of the game and protect its own threats.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to aggressively deploy creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer providing strong early game threats, supported by cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ocelot Pride for additional damage. Guide of Souls, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer powerful late-game options to close out the match. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and control the board with a mix of creatures and spells for a fast and efficient victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells to pressure the opponent. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt. The inclusion of Leyline cards help to control the board and protect against opposing spells. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption while cards like Consign to Memory offer flexibility in dealing with threats. With a mix of early aggression and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with early creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, backed up by powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to maintain pressure and control the board. The inclusion of cards like The Legend of Roku and Voice of Victory provide additional value and support to ensure a fast and efficient win condition. The deck also includes key land cards like Sacred Foundry and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana base.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing powerful and efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ranger-Captain of Eos. The deck aims to maintain board control with cards like Goblin Bombardment and utilize Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to pump up creatures for a strong finish. The inclusion of versatile spells like Thraben Charm and Arena of Glory helps to support the aggressive game plan and push for a quick victory.

The deck focuses on assembling pieces of the Broodscale Bloodchief combo, utilizing cards like Basking Broodscale, Blade of the Bloodchief, and Glaring Fleshraker to create a powerful board presence. It also includes Eldrazi creatures and support cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command for disruption and removal. The deck aims to ramp up with Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Stirrings, while also utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Vexing Bauble for additional value. It includes some utility cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Haywire Mite, as well as mana acceleration with Talisman of Impulse and Devourer of Destiny.

This Modern 1 vs 1 Ruby Storm deck focuses on generating as much mana as possible through spells like Manamorphose and Pyretic Ritual, while reducing the cost of spells with Ruby Medallion. The goal is to chain together spells and generate enough mana to cast a large Grapeshot or use Ral, Monsoon Mage's ultimate ability to deal massive damage to the opponent. Cards like Past in Flames and Wish help to recycle spells and find key pieces of the combo. The deck aims to win quickly through explosive plays and efficient use of resources.

The deck focuses on using creatures with undying abilities and powerful enters-the-battlefield effects to create a recurring toolbox of threats and answers. It utilizes cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt opponents while setting up a win condition with Walking Ballista or Grist, the Hunger Tide. The deck aims to generate value from sacrificing and returning creatures to the battlefield, building a strong presence over time while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The primary strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and creature removal. The deck focuses on controlling the board and maintaining card advantage through the use of powerful control spells such as Counterspell, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push. Additionally, the deck includes powerful creatures like Wan Shi Tong and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to provide additional threats and win conditions. The deck aims to outlast opponents and eventually secure victory through attrition and careful resource management.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls, it can power out powerful threats like Thought-Knot Seer and It That Heralds the End ahead of schedule. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to deploy a threatening board presence early on and maintain pressure to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and efficient mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and recursion while cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble help ramp up the mana for explosive plays. Quantum Riddler and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional threats and disruption while cards like Metallic Rebuke and Unholy Heat help control the board. The goal is to establish a powerful board presence early on and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently using cards like Ruby Medallion, Pyretic Ritual, and Manamorphose, in order to cast spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to create a storm of spells. By chaining together spells and generating mana, the deck can ultimately win the game by using cards like Grapeshot to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes ways to search for specific cards and draw cards to keep the combo going.

The deck focuses on utilizing various red mana ramp spells and card draw effects to quickly build up resources and cast powerful spells like Past in Flames, Grapeshot, and Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate a lethal storm combo. The deck also includes cards like Artist's Talent and Valakut Awakening to dig for key combo pieces. With a mix of fast mana generation and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and finish the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. The strategy revolves around quickly putting pressure on the opponent with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco, while also being able to control the board with Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to support the aggro plan by providing additional benefits and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of damage and tempo advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Solitude. The deck aims to control the board through targeted removal spells and disruptive creatures, while also utilizing powerful card advantage engines like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Meticulous Archive. By combining aggressive threats with disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victories through a combination of damage and disruption.

The main concept of this Modern control deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The deck includes powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, along with Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells, removal, and artifacts while ramping into powerful threats to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Echoes of Eternity and Mind Stone allows for card advantage and flexibility in gameplay.
